text: Good morning, good morning. Oh my gosh. I am so excited for
this morning. Today we are going out to the great barrier reef
and we are going to do some diving, snorkeling... I can't even
describe..its one of those things I wanted to do forever..
Man: This here is the scuba unit. Anyone here knows what
scuba stands for? Self contained underwater breathing apparatus
The number one most important rule of scuba diving is: always
breathe and never, ever hold your breath. In and out of our
mouths, nice and slowly. Its quite easy, just make sure you
don't hold breath. Second rule of scuba diving is when we go
underwater, you start to feel a bit of pressure in our ears. That
is no worries, we just have to equalize that pressure. The way
we do that is we take two fingers, pinch our nose and blow
against our nose. For every meter or so that we go down you
need to stop and equalize your ears.
Welcome to the Great Barrier Reef. I am so excited to be here.
As you can see I have already been in the water, couldn't wait
I had to go in.
Yea. Now we are getting on our scuba gear, and go scuba dive.
Hi guys. We are getting ready to go on our second scuba dive.
Are you excited? Girl: Yes. Water in my eye.
